alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Hall; Howard; Kearney; Sherman (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 4:11PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN ADAMS...NORTHEASTERN KEARNEY...EASTERN BUFFALO...SOUTHERN SHERMAN...SOUTHWESTERN HOWARD AND WESTERN HALL COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM CDT... At 411 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hazard to Poole to 6 miles south of Gibbon. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Gibbon and Ravenna around 415 PM CDT. Shelton around 420 PM CDT. Rockville around 425 PM CDT. Boelus around 430 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wood River, Cairo and Ashton. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 278 and 305. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for south central and central Nebraska.
